ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Calculating AC
ygData.msgSnippet: I didn t isolate it from other stats as that does not reflect Reality what I did was get a Gnoll necklace (2ac 5cha) and wear it.  Noted the AC increase then
ygData.messageBody:
I didn't isolate it from other stats as that does not reflect "Reality" what
I did was get a Gnoll necklace (2ac 5cha) and wear it. Noted the AC
increase then took it off.

When I wore the collar at level 33 it gave me 3 ac
When I wore the collar at level 34 it gave me 4 ac

Same exact equipment at both levels. I'll double check the numbers next
time I log on to EQ (maybe never. I'm so tired of EQ and us doing all their
testing for them, and being ignored when we find problems, that I've pretty
much completely moved to Asheron's Call). Note that I've been in EQ since
beta 2.

Lyrnia

----- Original Message -----
From: "David Blank" <EvilNuff@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2000 12:07 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Calculating AC


> From: David Blank <EvilNuff@...>
>
> A few questions/comments:
>
> >At level 33, 2AC item translates to 3 EAC
> >At level 34, 2AC item translates to 4 EAC
>
> I'd like more information here please. Specifically
> what were your defense levels at the time. How did
> you isolate that 2 AC item, were you naked other than
> it? As I stated elsewhere using bronze armor only
> (i.e. no stat boosts) and the same stats among
> varrying naked warriors of various levels I got the
> same effective ac from the same static set of armor
> regardless of level, skills, etc.
>
> -David
>
>
